reviewText:
Early Access Review

Skyflower is an Early Access arcade shooter with roguelike elements. You traverse through procedurally generated dungeons while shooting at enemies and collecting powerups. Unfortunately, there's not much to it.

Granted, the game is in Early Access, but it looks (and feels) like it's the developer's first game. Much of the game is unbalanced, especially in the enemy projectile patterns and character skillsets. The artwork is all pixelated, but it lacks the charm and polish of other games in its genre. Furthermore, the developer doesn't seem to be too invested in updating the game.

To be fair, for $3, it seems like the kind of game you would expect at its price. However, you'd be better off playing the multitude of other arcade shooters on Steam. Vintage Year, for instance, is more polished and interesting, and is only a couple dollars more. Nuclear Throne is still the best in its class, even though it's also in Early Access. Those are just a couple examples of purchases more worth your money.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Update 2: Still no updates and no word of whether this will be updated, would  recommend as a pass at this point.

Update 1: Lack of updates makes this less of a must-buy, as the one obvious game-breaking bug is still not addressed. Still find it fun, but not playable beyond NG.

Fun twin stick shooter that is entertaining, if yet incomplete. The controls are pretty tight, and the initial slow movement of the characters is offset by some of the items' effects. I'd say think of this as a stripped-down and still in early development Nuclear Throne
date:
but they seem to fill different niches, at least to me.

There are some ui and graphical issues, like the lightning effects not leaving the screen in some cases, or the player character and some static objects changing size (very minimally, perhaps because of how they are rendered?) when moving the cursor while standing still or moving slowly. The main menu and in-game pause menu need to be worked over (as the dev has said he plans to do in the next update).

Overall, I feel it's definitely worth the money (whether full price or on sale) to pick this up.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Update Feb 14th, 2016: Game hasn't been updated in around 6 months. Dev seems to have abandoned it. Don't waste your money on this.
-----
Original review:
-----
At the time of writing it's already a fun game, but it's still very early in it's development and needs a lot of work. The multi-player for example will notify you that it will likely crash. So keep that in mind if you're considering purchase. I'd still recommend it though, especially since it's cheap.

Oh and, no doubt this will get patched soon, but right now, hold O to get all the items in the game. Enjoy!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Got this from a Groupees bundle months ago. Downloaded the DRM-Free version and gave it a shot, I've always had an affinity for top-down shootyers in general. When you add things like perma-death and leveling,stats, power-ups, etc... it gives me nerd wood... big, huge, meaty nerd wood... or woody nerd meat??? I'm not quite sure now... but whatever..

great game for what it is... graphics are doo doo... but I personally don't care about that... the gameplay more than makes up for it... it's fast paced, it IS grindy, but it all goes so fast it doesn't feel like it....

for the price you can't beat it.... do buy. I have spoken.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qvHFJ9wzPJE&feature=youtu.be

It's like Ubermosh or Overture, but in bullet hell form. This doesn't mean it's bad, though it does seem like a possible Unity asset flip (I don't know personally if it is or not). It's got plenty of pretty colors as well, three different classes categorized by their special attacks, and a score that is catchy at times, but also can be barren or non-existent. Hopefully the audio is just due to being early access 1.1.

I have no idea if some of the things I think are glitches are meant to be there though. There's no options menu or anything that explains the controls over than a quick explanation on WASD and how the mouse works in the game. I hit O and P at times, and random things happened, as if I were using special items, not to mention sometimes hitting Z or T and teleporting to the next level.

It has potential, and I'm anxious to see further builds. I don't regret the purchase and suggest it while it's on sale if this is your kind of thing.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Killed a boring purple angel or something (since I couldn't get close enough to see it without taking damage and the next stage immediately froze.

This is a very good example of why Early Access needs extremely heavy restrictions. We have enough with huge teams of devs rushing their games to release in order to make money as quick as they can. We don't need that practice to be encouraged.

What we have here is a pretty decent game with absolutely game breaking design choices and bugs.

The first design choice that is extremely bad is after each boss, the weapon choices pop up...during the stage. You are being shot at while you must choose a weapon. How can one even make that choice? It's idiotic.

Another is stunlocking. If you get surrounded by enemies, you're stuck. And that's easy to do since enemies can spawn all around you. You become stuck and take tons of damage.

There are also sniper enemies that are virtually impossible to dodge. I got killed the moment I entered a stage just now. And at this point, the game mocks you which further proves how young the dev is and that this game was made to just mock us all and the industry as a whole.

Each character has a power. One is a spread weapon which is pretty alright and has multiple variants that spray bullets all over the screen or in a more concentrated beam. Another is a shield that lasts for 0.01 seconds. It's useless. What's balance? If I chose the shied, I probably wouldn't get anywhere. I definitely would not be able to destroy the purple whatever since it's too far for the regular attack unless I wanted to get killed and only slightly hurt it.

For the bugs, we have the above and a few more. There are healing points scattered throughout that do absolutely nothing at all. Then there are little red orbs of some kind that do absolutely nothing.

We need to be able to report these games for all of the above. A quick look into the forum revealed that the dev is probably very young and not at all feeling inclined to keep working on the game, despite being paid. He claimed to release an update in one week. That was months ago and nothing happened. Finally, he responded and said that school is in the way. Put down that common core garbage and get to work. You've sold a product now and it's your job to make sure that product isn't a broken mess.

(also, the description claims that you can solve puzzles. There isn't a single puzzle. False advertisement is also funny.)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Green Elf shot the FOOD! : 7/10
[ Fun: 7 | CTRL: 8 | GFX: 7 | SFX: 7 | Stable: Y | Replay: 7 ]

+ Great use of pixel art
+ Early access but fully playable and fully enjoyable
+ Deaths are amusing
+ Deceptively simple combat that gets frantic

~ Early access and hopefully will be improved and expanded on
~ Some enemies are seriously annoyingly tough
~ Some maps feel unfairly setup with traps and waves that are unavoidable
~ Boss battles are seriously tough

- Nothing bad.. for a budget price its well worth it right now

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First Hour ImpressionsSo I like to play the first hour of Early Access games and keep (rather pessimistic) notes about my experience: what I'm thinking, what I have a problem with and what I enjoy. I'm posting these notes for the developer to see to hopefully give them a good idea of how a completely new, unbiased player experiences their game for the first time. So this is mostly for the developer but if you're looking to try this game out, feel free to read through my notes. Warning: this will most likely get lengthy.


Gameplay NotesI know it's Early Access, but basic options would've been nice (like a music mute so I can play my own)
Throws you right into it with no mumbo-jumbo, good
The teleport should prompt the player perhaps, so they don't just leave tons of money/whatnot on the ground and leave the level prematurely on accident: I had no idea what the teleporter did, maybe a quick hint?
Teleporters are a bit random actually, I just hit one right after starting a level and it just teleported me to a different one in a random spot, what's going on?
Sort of slow-paced for a bullet-hell, at least movement-wise
No clue what this cross statue does or is, no clue what this red ball trophy does or is, no clue what this ethereal floating gray ball does or is, a TINY bit of explanation would be nice (alright, the ball hurts me, but how do I interact with the statue/trophy??)
Instead of SHIFT being a walk function, shouldn't it be a sprint? This is a bullet-hell
I guess there's something good about just learning as you play, but asking me to purchase items I know nothing about is a bit far, guess I'll just have to gamble...
Too easy
First boss WAY too easy
Nice progression in introducing new enemies, still don't know how the level progression works though
Items feel kind of like Risk of Rain-style, I like them
Alright, difficult isn't too easy, it's too spiky, first playthrough was easy as hell, second was insanely difficult, it should be balanced a bit more delicately
HINT TO NEW PLAYERS: The shield spell blocks one hit, it is NOT time-based
I'm having a lot of fun now, but I fear this will get very dull and repetitive quickly... There really isn't much variety at all
Game is way too easy now, get one lucky upgrade and you win
Some enemy designs are creative while others are just downright random or unfitting
Wait, I lost a key by going to the next level??? But not every level has a locked door, nor does every level that has a locked door have a key. Or at least I thought?
Chance of Lightning" item is a bit OP
